Author: forkwitch#6080
Content:
@Geocold51 Not much, been rewriting some part of the node stratum to be more efficient when testing 51wns. Lets you just set NUM val for the forklenght var and when external p2p feedbacks the equal forklength it will broadcast your found blocks again. Before it was manual handwork i believe you know... 
And Have you seen the CC in Komodo? Only thing i need to find out how to get all Komodo dpow chains notarisation information on one daemon where my cc is executed. Komodo RPC and my WAND RPC does not deliver this info. I believe the CC is a powerful and disruptive technology but so young and new. Not much of checks are added on CC lowlvl against attacks or bad intentioned data tampering.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, this is true

Content: As i am very interested in the CC i am reading and playing a lot and sharing all finding respecfully with you

Author: forkwitch#6080
Content: I have gotten the komodostats website. Thank you. It is executed on a webserver and we dont know from where the data source is.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: true, it is a trust required webpage. if you are running all the daemons, you can just do a getinfo and get the info from there

Author: forkwitch#6080
Content: This is the good decentralized solution. If i understand correct i can then use the oracle CC and create this trustfull source for all assetchain notarisation info that i looked for.

Author: forkwitch#6080
Content: @Gordon Komodo its a tool of blockchain security central, like notarisationarchive. You can get info of notarisation without running all daemons. Only one daemon. For example electrum server projects or projects with webwallets that dont use a full blockchain database copy can get all security information from this one p2p program!

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: @forkwitch  you can use the scannotarisationDB to get notarisetiong from KMD

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: its under crosschain or MoMoM

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: in the output of help

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it will return all notrarisations from all chains

Author: forkwitch#6080
Content: @blackjok3r is it stored into Komodo blockchain DB in realtime? The notarisation information of all DPOW tokens?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes

Author: forkwitch#6080
Content: If yes i can extract this alone with BCDB parse().

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: https://github.com/StakedChain/komodo/blob/master/src/notarisationdb.cpp

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I added prints there to print out when each notarisation was added

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you can do whatever you want from there.

Content: still has a few issues, but the raw data is likely solid

Author: blackjok3r#3181

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes
